Description: THE COLORADO RIVER SCIENCE WIKI IS A COLLABORATIVE, DYNAMIC HUB THAT PROVIDES UP-TO-DATE SCIENCE RESEARCH, REPORTS, AND SYNTHESIS RELEVANT TO THE COLORADO RIVER SYSTEM. IT CAN SERVE AS A CENTRAL CONNECTION BETWEEN THE RESEARCH COMMUNITY AND WATER MANAGEMENT AND STAKEHOLDER COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN. THE WIKI HAS THE POTENTIAL TO INCREASE THE IMPACT OF COLORADO RIVER-RELATED SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, RESOURCES, AND TOOLSMUCH OF IT PRODUCED OR FUNDED BY RECLAMATIONBY: (1) COLLATING RESEARCH INTO A SINGLE LOCATION, (2) SYNTHESIZING RESEARCH FINDINGS INTO SUMMARY PAGES, AND (3) FACILITATING THE DISCOVERY AND USE OF RELEVANT RESOURCES AND TOOLS BY WATER MANAGERS AND STAKEHOLDERS. THE IMPACT OF THE COLORADO RIVER SCIENCE WIKI SPANS BOTH THE UPPER AND LOWER COLORADO RIVER REGIONS.

THE GILA RIVER BASIN NATIVE FISHES CONSERVATION PROGRAM (PROGRAM) WAS ESTABLISHED IN RESPONSE TO SEVERAL BIOLOGICAL OPINIONS BETWEEN THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) AND THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE ON CENTRAL ARIZONA PROJECT WATER TRANSFERS TO THE GILA RIVER BASIN. A HIGH PRIORITY OF THE PROGRAM IS TO CONSERVE AND RECOVER NATIVE FISHES OF THE GILA RIVER BASIN BY PROTECTING AND REPLICATING REMAINING POPULATIONS OF FEDERALLY LISTED SPECIES, INCLUDING GILA TOPMINNOW (POECILIOPSIS OCCIDENTALIS), INTO THE WILD AND IN REFUGE FACILITIES. UNDERSTANDING THE GENETIC MAKEUP OF A SPECIES AND ITS POPULATIONS ARE CRITICAL TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF REESTABLISHMENT STRATEGIES AND CAPTIVE BREEDING PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS TO MAKE DECISIONS ABOUT WHICH CAPTIVE STOCK SHOULD BE INTRODUCED INTO A PARTICULAR SITE OR DRAINAGE.TASK 1: PRE-MICROSATELLITE WORK (20 ) - CONTRACTOR WILL OBTAIN ANY ADDITIONAL SAMPLES FROM COLLABORATORS, EXTRACT DNA AND PERFORM THE MOLECULAR WORK POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION (PCR), SANGER SEQUENCING, BIOINFORMATIC ANALYSES) TO VERIFY IDENTITY OF SPECIMENS.TASK 2: MICROSATELLITE WORK (70 ) - CONTRACTOR WILL PERFORM THE MOLECULAR WORK (PCR AND CAPILLARY ELECTROPHORESIS), AND ALLELE SCORING.TASK 3: POPULATION GENETICS ANALYSES AND MANUSCRIPT REPORT PREPARATION (100 ) - CONTRACTOR WILL COMPLETE THE ANALYSES AND INTERPRETATION OF RESULTS, PREPARE FINAL REPORT, ADDRESS NEEDED REVISIONS, AND PREPARE MANUSCRIPT FOR SUBMISSION TO SCIENTIFIC JOURNAL.

THIS PROJECT AIMS TO GATHER ENOUGH DATA TO CONFIRM WATER SAVINGS USING NEW IRRIGATION EFFICIENCY TECHNOLOGIES SO FUTURE LARGE SCALE, LONG TERM AGRICULTURAL EFFICIENCY PROGRAMS CAN BE IMPLEMENTED TO CONSERVE WATER.UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL COMPLETE PILOT TESTING AND DEMONSTRATION OF A GRAVITY-DRIVEN MICRO-DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEM, ASSESS WATER SAVINGS AND HARVEST PRODUCTIVITY, AND PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT REGARDING CROP YIELDS VERSUS WATER CONSERVATION.THE PROJECTS PILOT TEST LOCATIONS WILL BE LOCATED ON LAND OWNED AND MANAGED BY YUMA MESA IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT, COLORADO RIVER INDIAN TRIBES, AND WELTON MOHAWK IRRIGATION AND DRAINAGE DISTRICT.

THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN IN CURRENTLY IN ITS 23RD YEAR OF UNPRECEDENTED DROUGHT. INFLOWS INTO THE COLORADO RIVER HAVE DECLINED SIGNIFICANTLY CAUSING LAKE MEAD AND LAKE POWELL, THE NATION S TWO LARGEST RESERVOIRS, TO DECLINE TO HISTORICALLY LOW LEVELS. CLOUD SEEDING (ALSO KNOWN AS WEATHER MODIFICATION) IS A METHOD TO INCREASE PRECIPITATION AND SNOWPACK. THE INFORMATION PROVIDED THROUGH THESE PROJECTS BENEFITS THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN STAKEHOLDERS BY INCREASING KNOWLEDGE OF THIS METHOD WITH THE POTENTIAL TO HELP IMPROVE THE DROUGHT CONDITIONS WITHIN COLORADO RIVER BASIN. ALSO, SINCE 90  OF THE WATER IN LAKE MEAD ORIGINATES AS SNOWMELT IN THE UPPER BASIN, THE ADDITIONAL PRECIPITATION AND SNOW ACCUMULATION THAT CLOUD SEEDING CAN PROVIDE, IT DIRECTLY BENEFITS THE ENTIRETY OF THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN, INCLUDING THE COMMUNITIES AND ECOSYSTEMS THAT RELY ON THIS WATER SOURCE.IN 2018, AGENCIES WITHIN THE SEVEN BASIN STATES ENTERED INTO A PROGRAMMATIC FUNDING AGREEMENT WHERE THE LOWER BASIN ENTITIES, AND NEW MEXICO, COOPERATIVELY HAVE FUNDED WEATHER MODIFICATION PROJECTS MANAGED BY THE COLORADO WATER CONSERVATION BOARD, UTAH DIVISION OF WATER RESOURCES, AND WYOMING WATER DEVELOPMENT OFFICE (UPPER BASIN ENTITIES).STUDIES HAVE DEMONSTRATED THAT CLOUD SEEDING CAN INCREASE SNOWFALL BY 5 15  IN PARTS OF STORMS THAT ARE SEEDED. WHILE CLOUD SEEDING IS A NON IMPORT ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE METHOD, FOR CREATING ADDITIONAL WATER INFLOW INTO THE COLORADO RIVER SYSTEM, FURTHER RESEARCH IS NEEDED TO DETERMINE WHETHER THIS CAN MEANINGFULLY SUPPORT THE WATER NEEDS OF THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN, LOCAL COMMUNITIES, AND ECOSYSTEMS.THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO ENHANCE, IMPLEMENT, AND MONITOR AERIAL AND GROUND BASED CLOUD SEEDING PROJECTS BY TARGETING KEY SNOWPACK AREAS IN THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN. THE DATA GATHERED FROM THE PROGRAM CAN HELP FURTHER RESEARCH ON CLOUD SEEDING. THIS AGREEMENT IS EXPECTED TO ENHANCE THE PROJECTS BY CHANGING EXISTING MANUALLY OPERATED CLOUD SEEDING GENERATING EQUIPMENT TO NEW TECHNOLOGY THAT INCLUDES REMOTELY OPERATED GENERATORS. TECHNICAL REPORTS WILL BE PREPARED ANNUALLY THAT PROVIDE A NARRATIVE OF THE PROJECT GOALS, ACTIVITIES, AND EVALUATION OF DATA FINDINGS. THESE TECHNICAL REPORTS WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.THE PRIMARY RECIPIENT WILL PASS THROUGH THE FUNDING TO THE APPROPRIATE UPPER BASIN ENTITIES FOR OPERATIONS UNDER THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN WEATHER MODIFICATION AGREEMENT. THE PASS THROUGH ENTITIES WILL IDENTIFY AND SOLICIT THE CONTRACTORS TO PROVIDE THE NEW EQUIPMENT, AS WELL PERFORM AND IMPLEMENT THE AERIAL AND GROUND CLOUD SEEDING PROJECTS.

THIS PROJECT IS NEEDED TO ADDRESS THE HUMAN HEALTH IMPACTS, ESPECIALLY ON THE INDIGENOUS AND LATINO COMMUNITIES IN THE REGION AND WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL DATA FROM ONGOING AND PLANNED DUST MITIGATION PROJECTS IN THE REGION.DECLINING SEA LEVELS DUE TO THE IMPACTS OF PROLONGED DROUGHT, CLIMATE CHANGE, AND AGRICULTURAL TO URBAN WATER TRANSFERS ARE REDUCING INFLOWS, WHICH LOWER SURFACE WATER ELEVATIONS OF THE LAKE AND EXPOSING LAKEBED. THE EXPOSED LAKEBED CONTRIBUTES TO AIR QUALITY CHALLENGES THAT IMPACT HUMAN HEALTH BY EMITTING DUST. THIS DUST NEGATIVELY IMPACTS LOCAL AIR QUALITY AND POSES HEALTH RISKS TO RESIDENTS IN IMPERIAL AND RIVERSIDE COUNTIES. COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING THE SEA EXPERIENCE A HIGHER INCIDENCE OF ASTHMA, BROADLY ATTRIBUTED TO THE DUST GENERATED IN THE REGION.THIS STUDY WILL INVOLVE COLLECTION OF WATER, PLAYA SOIL, AND DUSTS COLLECTED FROM SEVERAL SITES AROUND SALTON SEA ACROSS SEASONS. COLLECTION SITES AT DIFFERENT DISTANCES FROM THE SEA WILL ALSO HELP ASSESS THE IMPACT OF DISTANCE FROM THE EXPOSED PLAYA ON THE COMPOSITION OF THE COLLECTED DUST. IN THIS PROJECT, THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK WITH OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY SITES AROUND THE SALTON SEA WHERE THE IMPACT OF AEROSOL DUST GENERATION AT EXPOSED PLAYA IS OF PARTICULAR CONCERN. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A SUBRECIPIENT WITH HEALTH ASSESSMENT AND RESEARCH FOR COMMUNITIES (HARC), A NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT COLLECTS HEALTH ASSESSMENT SURVEY DATA IN THE COMMUNITY, WHICH WILL USE COMMUNITY BASED SURVEYS AND GEOSPATIAL MAPPING TO HELP US IDENTIFY THE COMMUNITIES MOST SEVERELY IMPACTED BY THE PROXIMITY TO SALTON SEA DUSTS.PROJECT MAY INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING KEY ACTIVITIES AND OBJECTIVES COLLECT SALTON SEA WATER, LAKE SEDIMENTS, PLAYA SURFACE AND SUBSURFACE SOIL, AND DUST GENERATED AT AREAS WITH EXPOSED PLAYA, AND FURTHER FROM THE SEA SAMPLES WILL BE ANALYZED BY SEVERAL CRITERIA, INCLUDING ORGANIC CONTENT, ESPECIALLY COMPONENTS ASSOCIATED WITH MICROBES IN THE SALTON SEA ECOSYSTEM CONDUCT SURVEY S OF COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING THE SALTON SEA TO IDENTIFY COMMUNITIES WITH HIGHEST INCIDENCE OF CHILDHOOD ASTHMA SYMPTOMS USE GEOSPATIAL MAPPING TOOLS TO IDENTIFY ANY CORRELATIONS BETWEEN THE PREVALENCE OF ASTHMA SYMPTOMS AND PROXIMITY TO EXPOSED SALTON SEA PLAYA COORDINATE WITH AND PRESENT RESULTS TO RECLAMATION AND CALIFORNIA NATURAL RESOURCES AGENCY.

ALTHOUGH CHEMICAL PHOSPHORUS REMOVAL HAS BEEN PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN MEETING LOWER PHOSPHORUS TARGETS, SOUTH PLATTE RENEW WOULD LIKE TO IMPLEMENT SIDESTREAM ENHANCED BIOLOGICAL PHOSPHORUS REMOVAL TO OPTIMIZE CHEMICAL COSTS, REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF ADDITIONAL ALUMINUM, IRON, CHLORIDE, AND SULFATE DISCHARGED TO THE SOUTH PLATTE RIVER (RESULTING FROM CHEMICAL PHOSPHORUS REMOVAL), AND IMPROVE PROCESS RESILIENCY AND EFFICIENCY. SOUTH PLATTE RENEW WILL UTILIZE EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE TO DEVELOP AN INTERNAL CARBON SOURCE FOR THE PHOSPHATE ACCUMULATING ORGANISMS THAT WILL RESIDE IN A SIDESTREAM ANAEROBIC REACTOR. SOUTH PLATTE RENEW WILL FIRST THICKEN ITS PRIMARY SLUDGE AND THEN SEND THE THICKENED SLUDGE TO A GRAVITY THICKENER (PHYSICALLY AND MECHANICALLY MODIFIED DISSOLVED AIR FLOW TANK TO OPERATE AS A GRAVITY THICKENER) TO SEPARATE THE THICKENED PRIMARY SLUDGE FROM THE LIQUID STREAM CONTAINING READILY BIODEGRADABLE CHEMICAL OXYGEN DEMAND AND VOLATILE FATTY ACIDS. SOUTH PLATTE RENEW WILL THEN SUPPLY THE SIDESTREAM ANAEROBIC REACTOR (AN EXISTING REAERATION BASIN RETROFITTED TO OPERATE AS AN ANAEROBIC REACTOR) WITH RETURN ACTIVATED SLUDGE AND THE INTERNAL CARBON SOURCE. SOUTH PLATTE RENEW ANTICIPATES THAT APPROXIMATELY 243 POUNDS PER DAY OF ORTHOPHOSPHORUS WILL BE REMOVED BY SENDING 0.53 MILLION GALLONS PER DAY OF THE INTERNALLY SOURCED CARBON TO THE SIDESTREAM ANAEROBIC REACTOR, LOWERING THE OPERATING COSTS AND PREVENTING INCREASES IN EFFLUENT TOTAL DISSOLVED SOLIDS ASSOCIATED WITH CHEMICAL PHOSPHORUS REMOVAL.

THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS FOR ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY TO ASSIST BUREAU OF RECLAMATION IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TESTING PROGRAM TO EVALUATE THE POTENTIAL FOR MICROBIALLY INDUCED DESATURATION TO PROVIDE INTERIM MITIGATION OF THE RISK POSED BY EARTHQUAKE INDUCED SOIL LIQUEFACTION TO EARTHEN DAMS. INSTABILITY AND LARGE DEFORMATIONS DUE TO LIQUEFACTION PRESENTS A MAJOR RISK TO MANY EARTHEN DAMS OWNED AND OPERATED BY THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION. THE COST AND TIME REQUIRED TO EFFECTIVELY MITIGATE THIS RISK REQUIRES THAT THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION PRIORITIZE ITS REMEDIAL ACTIONS AND IMPLEMENT INTERIM MEASURES ON DAMS WHICH CANNOT BE REMEDIATED RIGHT AWAY. MICROBIALLY INDUCED DESATURATION IS AN EMERGING TECHNOLOGY FOR NON-DISRUPTIVE MITIGATION OF LIQUEFACTION BEING DEVELOPED BY ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY THAT HOLDS THE POTENTIAL FOR COST EFFECTIVE INTERIM LIQUEFACTION RISK MITIGATION. ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE FUNDED INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:LABORATORY TESTING PROGRAMBENCHTOP TANK TESTINGLARGE SCALE FIELD TEST

ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY (ASU) WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO THE BUREAU OF RECLAMATION (RECLAMATION) FOR EVALUATION OF THE POTENTIAL FOR MICROBIALLY INDUCED DESATURATION (MID) TO PROVIDE INTERIM MITIGATION OF THE RISK POSED BY EARTHQUAKE INDUCED SOIL LIQUEFACTION (LIQUEFACTION) TO EARTHEN DAMS. INSTABILITY AND LARGE DEFORMATIONS DUE TO LIQUEFACTION PRESENTS A MAJOR RISK TO MANY EARTHEN DAMS OWNED AND OPERATED BY RECLAMATION. THE COST AND TIME REQUIRED TO EFFECTIVELY MITIGATE THIS RISK REQUIRES THAT RECLAMATION PRIORITIZE ITS REMEDIAL ACTIONS AND IMPLEMENT INTERIM MEASURES ON DAMS WHICH CANNOT BE REMEDIATED RIGHT AWAY. MID IS AN EMERGING TECHNOLOGY FOR NON-DISRUPTIVE MITIGATION OF LIQUEFACTION BEING DEVELOPED BY ASU THAT HOLDS THE POTENTIAL FOR COST EFFECTIVE INTERIM LIQUEFACTION RISK MITIGATION. THEREFORE, IT IS IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF RECLAMATION AND ITS STAKEHOLDERS TO INVESTIGATE THIS EMERGING TECHNOLOGY.

REVERSE OSMOSIS OPERATION IS AN ENERGY-INTENSIVE PROCESS, AND THE COST OF REVERSE OSMOSIS  TREATMENT CAN BE A BARRIER TO ITS WIDESPREAD ADOPTION. IN MOST BRACKISH AND SEAWATER DESALINATION AND WATER REUSE APPLICATIONS, REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANE RECOVERY (AND PRODUCTION) IS LIMITED BY SCALING CHEMISTRY. THE REVERSE OSMOSIS  MEMBRANE TRAINS ARE TYPICALLY OPERATED IN A STEADY STATE FLOW CONDITION OPTIMIZED FOR A WATER RECOVERY SETPOINT WITH NO ABILITY FOR REAL-TIME ADJUSTMENT OF FLOW, PRESSURE, AND MEMBRANE FLUX TO ACCOMMODATE CHANGING WATER QUALITY AND MEMBRANE PERFORMANCE CONDITIONS. DESIGN AND OPERATING PARAMETERS ARE BASED ON CONSERVATIVE DESIGN CONDITIONS TO MAXIMIZE WATER RECOVERY WHILE MEETING PRODUCT QUALITY OBJECTIVES AND AVOIDING SCALING OR FOULING. FURTHER LIMITING THE ABILITY TO BUILD AUTOMATION INTO PROCESS CONTROLS, MANY REVERSE OSMOSIS FACILITIES LACK THE ABILITY TO INTEGRATE SENSOR DATA FROM DISPARATE SOURCES AND EVALUATE THE DATA QUALITY IN REAL TIME. GIVEN THE CONSERVATIVE APPROACH AND MANUAL DATA ANALYTICS AND NORMALIZATION THERE ARE OPPORTUNITIES TO OPERATE AT MORE EFFICIENT SETTINGS. THUS, THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO USE CONNECTED SENSORS AND REAL-TIME DATA ACQUISITION COUPLED WITH MACHINE LEARNING AND THE LATEST IN PROCESS AUTOMATION TO DEVELOP PREDICTIVE ALGORITHMS WITH AUTOMATED ADVISORY PROCESS CONTROLS THAT CAN OPTIMIZE PUMP ENERGY, MEMBRANE FLUX (I.E., PRODUCTION), REVERSE OSMOSIS RECOVERY AND REVERSE OSMOSIS FEED ACID DOSING  ANTISCALANT DOSING TO REDUCE ENERGY, MAXIMIZE PRODUCTION, AND MINIMIZE CHEMICAL COSTS WHILE MAINTAINING MEMBRANE CONDITION BY MINIMIZING FOULING AND SCALING.

THE DESTRUCTION OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES REMAINS A CRITICAL HURDLE IN THE REMEDIATION OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES CONTAMINATED SITES. WHILE PREVIOUS BENCH-SCALE STUDIES HAVE ESTABLISHED THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ELECTROCHEMICAL OXIDATION AS A PROMISING  PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES DESTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY, THE BULK OF THESE STUDIES EXTRAPOLATE DESTRUCTION PERFORMANCE USING SYNTHETIC PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES CONTAMINATED MATRICES. IN THIS PROPOSED TWO-PHASE PILOT STUDY, AN ELECTROCHEMICAL OXIDATION PILOT SKID WILL BE OPERATED IN THE TREATMENT OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES IMPAIRED MEMBRANE CONCENTRATE FROM THE BRACKISH GROUNDWATER NATIONAL DESALINATION RESEARCH FACILITY IN ALAMOGORDO, NEW MEXICO. THIS PILOT DEMONSTRATION SEEKS TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE LONG TERM PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES DESTRUCTION PERFORMANCE OF ELECTROCHEMICAL OXIDATION TO SUPPLEMENT THE RESIDUALS HANDLING ASSOCIATED WITH EXISTING PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES MEMBRANE SEPARATION PROCESSES. OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT MAY REDUCE THE LONG-TERM ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES IMPAIRED MEMBRANE CONCENTRATE DISPOSAL WITH LOWER ENERGY REQUIREMENTS AND COST THAN OTHER DESTRUCTION APPROACHES.

CAROLLO ENGINEERS HAS TEAMED WITH EASTERN MUNICIPAL WATER DISTRICT, CAL POLY POMONA, DUPONT, AND AQUACYCL TO SET UP AND OPERATE A NOVEL WASTEWATER PILOT TREATMENT CONFIGURATION TO PRODUCE WATER SUITABLE FOR RECHARGING GROUNDWATER BASINS, WHILE DIVERTING ORGANIC CARBON AND CONSUMING LESS ELECTRICAL POWER THAN CONVENTIONAL APPROACHES, AND WHILE PROVIDING A MEANS TO REMOVE CHEMICALS OF EMERGING CONCERN FROM THE ENVIRONMENT. A 20 TO 30-GPM PILOT SYSTEM INCORPORATING TREATMENT OF PRIMARY EFFLUENT WITH MICROFILTRATION, CLOSED CIRCUIT REVERSE OSMOSIS, AND A MICROBIAL FUEL CELL OPERATING ON THE REVERSE OSMOSIS CONCENTRATE WILL BE SET UP AT AN EXISTING WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT. THIS STUDY WILL HELP TO FURTHER DEVELOP A MORE ENERGY EFFICIENT APPROACH TO PRODUCE WATER FOR GROUNDWATER RECHARGE AND HELP TO ADDRESS THE GROWING NEED TO FIND SOLUTIONS TO REMOVE CHEMICALS OF EMERGING CONCERNS, INCLUDING PFAS, FROM THE ENVIRONMENT. IF SUCCESSFUL, THE NOVEL TREATMENT APPROACH COULD BE APPLIED AT WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANTS CONSIDERING GROUNDWATER RECHARGE IN BOTH COASTAL AND INLAND COMMUNITIES.

DESTRUCTION OF PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES MOLECULES BY ANY METHOD IS AN ENERGY-INTENSIVE ENDEAVOR. BREAKING THE MOLECULES INTO NONTOXIC COMPONENTS REQUIRES BREAKING A MULTITUDE OF CARBON-FLUORINE BONDS, ONE OF THE STRONGEST BONDS IN NATURE. AS A RESULT, ENERGY USE IS AN INHIBITOR AND THE PREDOMINANT COST DRIVER FOR COMMERCIALIZING PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES DESTRUCTION TECHNOLOGIES. THIS PROJECT WILL TEST A FIELD-SCALE PILOT TO EVALUATE THE TECHNICAL EFFECTIVENESS AND ECONOMIC FEASIBILITY OF COMBINING FOAM FRACTIONATION, A PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES CONCENTRATION APPROACH, WITH THE PATENTED PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES DESTRUCTION TECHNOLOGY TO DESTRUCT PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES  IN INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER AT A COMMERCIAL CHEMICAL PRODUCER. THE SUCCESS CRITERION IS TO CONTINUOUSLY TREAT THE INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER AT THE REQUIRED FLOW RATE AND DECREASE THE PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES COMPOUNDS TO CONCENTRATIONS THAT MEET REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS IN THE PLANT DISCHARGE AT AN AFFORDABLE PRICE.

INCREASED PARTICLE LOADINGS ARE FREQUENTLY CHALLENGING FOR DRINKING WATER TREATMENT FACILITIES, SPECIFICALLY DIRECT FILTRATION PLANTS, AND MAY RESULT IN DECREASED WATER PRODUCTION CAPACITY AND FINISHED WATER QUALITY. CONVENTIONAL CLARIFICATION PROCESSES ARE USED TO ADDRESS HIGHER PARTICLE LOADINGS BUT REQUIRE A SIGNIFICANT FOOTPRINT AND CAPITAL COST FOR SYSTEMS THAT MAY BE USED ONLY ON AN INTERMITTENT BASIS. THIS PROJECT EXAMINES THE INTEGRATION OF DISSOLVED AIR FLOTATION INTO THE EXISTING FOOTPRINT OF THE TREATMENT PLANT, BETWEEN FLOCCULATION BASINS AND FILTER INFLUENT, TO REMOVE THESE PARTICLES. DISSOLVED AIR FLOTATION INTRODUCES AIR BUBBLES TO ATTACH TO PARTICLES AND PARTICLE-BUBBLE AGGREGATES FLOAT TO THE SURFACE WHERE THEY ARE MECHANICALLY REMOVED. IF AN INNOVATIVE DISSOLVED AIR FLOTATION SOLUTION CAN BE INCORPORATED INTO THE EXISTING TREATMENT PROCESS, IT COULD BE OPERATED ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS TO REDUCE PARTICLE LOADINGS TO THE FILTERS AND MAINTAIN WATER PRODUCTION RATES, WHILE SIGNIFICANTLY REDUCING FOOTPRINT AND CAPITAL COST REQUIREMENTS OF A NEW CONVENTIONAL CLARIFICATION SYSTEM. ADDITIONALLY, INTEGRATION OF DISSOLVED AIR FLOTATION INTO THE FILTER BACKWASHING PROCEDURE WILL BE EXAMINED TO MINIMIZE BACKWASH VOLUMES AND PRODUCE WATER SAVINGS. LEARNINGS DISSEMINATED THROUGH THE FINAL REPORT, PRESENTATIONS, AND PEER-REVIEWED PUBLICATION, CAN BE USED TO INFORM OTHER DIRECT FILTRATION PLANTS THAT ARE CONSIDERING TREATMENT OPTIONS FOR ELEVATED PARTICLE LOADINGS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO DETERMINE THE FEASIBILITY OF REMOVING PER- AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES FROM IMPAIRED SOURCE WATERS IN SITU DURING MANAGED AQUIFER RECHARGE VIA DEPLOYMENT OF A NOVEL ADSORBENT MEDIA IN NATIVE SOILS TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY OF THE SOIL AQUIFER TREATMENT PROCESS. PILOT-SCALE COLUMN TESTING WILL BE PERFORMED USING SANTA ANA RIVER WATER WHICH HAS LOW CONCENTRATION POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES. PERFORMANCE OF CONTROL COLUMNS (PACKED WITH NATIVE SOILS ONLY) WILL BE COMPARED AGAINST TREATMENT COLUMNS, WHICH WILL BE LOADED WITH NATIVE SOIL AND NOVEL ADSORBENT MEDIA UNDERNEATH. FIELD DEMONSTRATION SCALE TESTING WILL EVALUATE THE PERFORMANCE OF THE PROPOSED TECHNOLOGY IN THE FIELD AT DEMONSTRATION SCALE UP TO 0.5 ACRES. THIS TESTING WILL ASSESS THE OVERALL FEASIBILITY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF THE PROPOSED TECHNOLOGY FOR REMOVING POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES BY QUANTITATIVE COMPARISON OF THE DUAL BED SYSTEM TO NON-MODIFIED, NATIVE INFILTRATION. THE PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL BENEFIT THE BROADER WATER COMMUNITY, PARTICULARLY ENTITIES STRUGGLING WITH POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES REMOVAL FROM WATER WITH ELEVATED CARBON CONTENT.

THIS WORK SUPPORTS A PUBLIC PURPOSE, AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC, INCLUSIVE OF STATE GOVERNMENTS AND WATER USE ORGANIZATIONS, ARE THE DIRECT RECIPIENTS OF WATER AND POWER PRODUCTION FROM THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN. MANAGEMENT DECISIONS BASED ON WATER CONSUMPTIVE USE (LOSS) RESEARCH, AND DROUGHT CONDITIONS WILL IMPACT WATER FLOWS, DAMS, AND POWER PLANT PRODUCTION IN THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN, HAVING A DIRECT IMPACT ON PUBLIC USERS. THE STATES ARE REPRESENTED THROUGH THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER COMMISSION (UCRC) AND WILL BE DIRECTLY IMPACTED BY WATER MANAGEMENT DECISIONS BASED ON THE QUALITY OF DATA PRODUCED BY THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE STATIONS AND TOWNS THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FOR.THE FOUR STATES OF THE UPPER DIVISION (COLORADO, NEW MEXICO, UTAH, AND WYOMING), THROUGH THE UCRC, AND IN COOPERATION WITH RECLAMATION, INITIATED A STUDY TO ASSESS AND IMPROVE CONSUMPTIVE USE ESTIMATES FROM IRRIGATED AGRICULTURAL LANDS IN THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN. THAT STUDY, ASSESSING AGRICULTURAL CONSUMPTIVE USE IN THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN (PHASE I, DECEMBER 2013) AND PHASE II, RESULTED IN A RECOMMENDATION THAT SEVERAL WEATHER STATIONS (EXISTING AND NEW) BE FORMALLY IDENTIFIED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING INFORMATION FOR CONSUMPTIVE USE ESTIMATES FROM IRRIGATED LANDS. THE DATA COLLECTED FROM THIS "UPPER BASIN CLIMATE NETWORK" (UB NETWORK) WILL BE UTILIZED IN ONGOING STUDIES ASSOCIATED WITH ASSESSING CONSUMPTIVE USE CALCULATIONS. THESE STUDIES ARE IMPORTANT TO THE INDIVIDUAL STATES, THE UCRC, AND RECLAMATION. THE UPPER BASIN CLIMATE NETWORK INCLUDES TEN (10) NEW STATIONS THAT WERE INSTALLED IN COLORADO IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ASCE-EWRI 2005 PROTOCOLS.GIVEN THE TIME AND RESOURCES SPENT ON THE PHASE I AND II STUDIES AND THE UPGRADED AND NEWLY INSTALLED STATIONS, AS WELL AS THE IMPORTANCE OF THE UB NETWORK FOR CONSUMPTIVE USE ESTIMATES IN THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER BASIN, THE PARTIES WANT TO ENSURE THE STATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO BE OPERATED AND MAINTAINED TO AN AGREED LEVEL OF STANDARDS, AND THAT ALL COLLECTED DATA WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO ANY AND ALL USERS IN A CONSISTENT FORMAT.

IN THE PROPOSED 18 MONTH PROJECT DEVELOPMENT REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANE MONITORING TECHNOLOGY FOR AUTOMATIC FEED BACK CONTROL OF REVERSE OSMOSIS PLANTS WILL EMERGE IN NEW DISRUPTIVE APPROACHES FOR SAFE PLANTS OPERATION AT OR NEAR OPTIMAL CONDITIONS  PREVIOUSLY DIFFICULT TO ACHIEVE DUE TO MEMBRANE FOULING   THIS WOULD REQUIRE NEW PROCESS CONTROL METHODOLOGIES FOR PROCESSING REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANE MONITORING DATA TO GENERATE APPROPRIATE CONTROL ACTIONS FOR REAL TIME PLANT OPTIMIZATION THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL BE USED FOR MODEL DEVELOPMENT AND SIMULATIONS THAT WILL BE USED FOR AND PRESENTED IN A MULTI STAKEHOLDER  APPROX   30 PARTNERS  COLLABORATIVE PROCESSES THROUGH THE RIO GRANDE BASIN STUDY, AS WELL AS FOR OTHER COLLABORATIVE PLANNING PROCESSES IN THE UPPER RIO GRANDE BASIN  THE PARTNERS ON THE RIO GRANDE BASIN STUDY INCLUDE  TRIBES, IRRIGATION DISTRICTS, CITY MUNICIPALITIES AND NON GOVERNMENT COMMUNITY GROUPSTHE MODELING PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS WILL HELP MULTIPLE COMMUNITIES ASSESS EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGES AND POSSIBLE ADAPTATIONS TO FUTURE CHANGES IN WATER SUPPLY AND DEMAND THIS PROJECT SHALL PRODUCE A SCREENING ANALYSIS CAPABILITY FOR IDENTIFYING VULNERABILITIES AND EVALUATING PROMISING ADAPTATION OPTIONS FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION  THE TASKS SHALL FACILITATE SUCH FURTHER INVESTIGATIONS BY PROVIDING THE CAPABILITY FOR CLIMATE STRESS TESTING THE BASIN AND LEVERAGING THE MODEL CREATION EFFORTS ALREADY COMPLETED OR UNDERWAY

THIS AGREEMENT WILL CONTINUE TO ADVANCE THE MANY OBJECTIVE ROBUST DECISION MAKING  MORDM  FRAMEWORK THAT IS EXPECTED TO PROVIDE MULTIPLE BENEFITS TO THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN  CRB  STAKEHOLDERS  TECHNICAL STAFF AND DECISION MAKERS IN AGENCIES, SUCH AS THE CENTRAL ARIZONA WATER CONSERVANCY DISTRICT, THE METROPOLITAN WATER DISTRICT, THE UPPER COLORADO RIVER COMMISSION, THE STATE OF WYOMING, THE WESTERN AREA POWER ADMINISTRATION, TRIBES, NON GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, ETC , REQUIRE ADVANCED TECHNICAL INFORMATION AS THEY EXPLORE POTENTIAL NEW POLICIES  IN PARTICULAR, THE INFORMATION AND METHODS THAT INCORPORATE ROBUSTNESS AND ADAPTATION WILL BE EXTREMELY VALUABLE TO A NEGOTIATION PROCESS THAT MUST CONTEND WITH UNCERTAINTY OVER THE COURSE OF THE EARLIER STUDIES, RECLAMATION AND RESEARCHERS IDENTIFIED MULTIPLE OPPORTUNITIES TO INCREASE THE BENEFITS OF THE MORDM FRAMEWORK  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL EXPAND ON PREVIOUS EFFORTS IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS  EMPLOYING ADVANCED ANALYSES ON PERFORMANCE AND ROBUSTNESS DATA, INCORPORATING ROBUSTNESS CONSIDERATIONS INTO THE POLICY SEARCH, IDENTIFYING ADAPTATION TRIGGERS, AND EXPLORING HOW ADAPTATIVE POLICIES CAN INCREASE SYSTEM RELIABILITY IN THE FACE OF UNCERTAINTY IN YEAR 1, THE TEAM WILL BUILD ON ITS UNDERSTANDING OF RECENT RESEARCH IN ADAPTIVE DECISION MAKING, UTILIZING ROBUST OPTIMIZATION AS A MEANS TO GENERATE DIVERSE POLICIES TO INCREASE CRB ADAPTABILITY  IN YEAR 2, THE TEAM WILL PROCESS RESULTS OF MULTIPLE ROBUST OPTIMIZATION TRIALS, UTILIZING THOSE POLICIES IN A TIME VARYING ADAPTIVE POLICYMAKING PROTOCOL

THE PURPOSE OF THE AGREEMENT IS TO TRANSFER FUNDS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF OKLAHOMA FOR WETLAND MESOCOSM STUDIES SUPPORTING INTEGRATION OF WATER REUSE AND STORMWATER MANAGEMENT THE OBJECTIVE OF THE PROPOSED RESEARCH IS TO COMPREHENSIVELY EVALUATE BIOGEOCHEMICAL AND PHYSICOCHEMICAL TRANSFORMATIONS  E G , SORPTION, PHOTOLYSIS, BIODEGRADATION  OF CECS UNDER CONTROLLED EXPERIMENTAL CONDITIONS IN TREATMENT WETLAND MESOCOSMS THE UNIVERSITY WILL COMPREHENSIVELY EVALUATE THE BIOGEOCHEMICAL AND PHYSICOCHEMICAL TRANSFORMATIONS  E G , SORPTION, PHOTOLYSIS, BIODEGRATION  OF CONSTITUENTS OF EMERGING CONCERN  CEC  UNDER CONTROLLED EXPERIMENTAL CONDITIONS IN TREATMENT WETLAND MESOCOSMS THE UNIVERSITY WILL ALSO BUILD A MESOCOSM SPECIFICALLY FOR THE PROJECT AND ASSESS THE CEC REMOVAL PROCESS AND BIOLOGICAL REMOVAL PROCESSES THROUGH URBAN STORMWATER ACTIVITIES COMPLETED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL ASSIST IN THE GENERATION OF SOURCE WATER AND RECEIVING BASELINE DATA, EVALUATING WATER TREATMENT CONFIGURATIONS, AND DEVELOPING CONCEPTUAL TREATMENT WETLAND DESIGNS

COLORADO SCHOOL OF MINES  CSM  WILL RESEARCH WITH THE USE OF DISTRIBUTED FIBER OPTIC SENSING  DFOS  TECHNOLOGIES AND OTHER ELECTRICAL AND SEISMIC IMAGING GEOPHYSICAL TECHNIQUES FOR A VARIETY OF LARGER CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE ASSESSMENT AND STRUCTURAL HEALTH MONITORING APPLICATIONS OF THE GRANBY DIKE  3 LOCATED NEAR GRANBY, COLORADO

1. AWARD PURPOSE:THE RECIPIENT HAS PROPOSED TO RECLAMATION TO PROVIDE PUBLIC OUTREACH PROGRAMS, SUCH AS WATER TOURS AND BRIEFINGS, THAT PRESENT INFORMATION REGARDING: 1) IMPLEMENTATION OF LARGE-SCALE PROJECT PLANNING EFFORTS; THESE PROGRAMS ARE TARGETED TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC, AS WELL AS LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL OFFICIALS, TO EDUCATE AND PROVIDE MEANINGFUL COMMUNICATION ABOUT ACTIVITIES THAT AFFECT THE KLAMATH BASIN. THESE PUBLIC OUTREACH PROGRAMS ARE RELATED TO WATER SUPPLY RELIABILITY, WATER QUALITY, AND ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION EFFORTS IN THE BASIN.2.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE USBR-KLAMATH BASIN AREA OFFICE (KBAO) HAS DETERMINED A NEED FOR THE ACQUISITION, POST-PROCESSING, AND WEB-HOSTED DISPLAY AND RETRIEVAL ACCESS OF NEAR-REAL TIME UPPER KLAMATH LAKE (UKL) OPEN WATER EVAPORATION MEASUREMENT DATA AND COMPUTED EVAPORATIVE LOSS ESTIMATES. KBAO HAS PERFORMED SIMILAR OPEN WATER EVAPORATION MEASUREMENT WORK IN THE PAST WHEREBY MONITORING STATIONS WERE DEPLOYED ON TWO OTHER RESERVOIRS IN THE UPPER KLAMATH BASIN OVER THE COURSE OF A THREE-YEAR STUDY PERIOD. UNDERSTANDING THE BENEFITS GAINED FROM THIS WORK BY WAY OF IMPROVING WATER BUDGET ESTIMATES AND INTRA-ANNUAL IMPACTS TO WATER SUPPLIES FOR THE TWO RESERVOIRS, RESPECTIVELY, KBAO IS INTENT ON CAPTURING EVAPORATIVE LOSS METRICS ON UPPER KLAMATH LAKE TO IMPROVE ITS WATER BUDGET ESTIMATES AND WATER SUPPLY PROJECTIONS. A WEB-BASED PORTAL WILL BE DEVELOPED TO ALLOW FOR REAL-TIME DATA ACCESS AND MONITORING BY THE STAKEHOLDERS. THIS WEB PORTAL WILL BE MODELED AFTER THE BOR'S LAKE POWELL INTERFACE (POWELL.DRI.EDU) AND WILL INCLUDE TOOLS TO VIEW CURRENT AND HISTORICAL DATA IN BOTH TABULAR AND GRAPH FORMATS. AN EXAMPLE REAL-TIME ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING AND ALERTING SYSTEMS (REMAS) WEB INTERFACE CAN BE FOUND BELOW IN FIGURE 1. DRI WILL WORK WITH THE STAKEHOLDERS TO CUSTOMIZE THE WEB PORTAL, POTENTIALLY INCLUDING GRAPHIC PRESENTATIONS, DOWNLOADING FEATURES, AND THE ADDITION OF HIGHER-LEVEL SUMMARY DATA AND/OR STATISTICS PRESENTATIONS. COMPLEX CUSTOMIZATIONS AND DEVELOPMENT OF HIGHER-LEVEL GRAPHICS BEYOND WHAT IS CURRENTLY BEING DEPLOYED UNDER THE LAKE POWELL INTERFACE MAY REQUIRE ADDITIONAL FUNDING.3.EXPECTED DELIVERABLES OR OUTCOMES:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS CONTRACT IS TO ACQUIRE, COMPUTE, AND DISPLAY NEAR-REAL TIME OPEN WATER EVAPORATION DATA VIA AN INTERNET-BASED GRAPHICAL USER INTERFACE SUCH THAT EXTERNAL STAKEHOLDERS HAVE READY ACCESS TO THE DATA.4.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFITS TO BE DERIVED FROM THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE DESERT RESEARCH PRODUCING A COMPLETED, UPDATED WATER MANAGEMENT PLANS THAT IMPLEMENTS THE FINDINGS/CORRECTIVE ACTIONS IN THEIR WATER MANAGEMENT PLAN TO INCREASE QUALITY WATER TO RESIDENTS' AREAS WITH A HIGH INCIDENT OF DROUGHT RELATED WATER SHORTAGES. THE WATER SAVED WILL KEEP THE PUBLIC CONSUMER'S COSTS DOWN BY REDUCING OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE COSTS.ADDITIONALLY, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL CONTINUE TO LEARN ABOUT RECLAMATION'S ROLE IN PROMOTING WATER CONSERVATION BY PROMOTING THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN DESERT RESEARCH AND THE BUREAU THROUGH A DIRECT MAILING CAMPAIGN, THE WEB SITE AND DURING PUBLIC MEETINGS. WATER DISTRICTS WILL ALSO TAKE AN ACTIVE LEAD IN PROMOTING AND IMPLEMENTING WATER CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. 5.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES (IF KNOWN OR SPECIFIED AT TIME OF AWARD): N/A

CURRENTLY, METHODS USED TO DIRECTLY MEASURE MICROBIAL CONTAMINATION ARE LABOR INTENSIVE AND TIME INSENSITIVE. THERE IS A NEED FOR A LOW COST, COMPACT FULLY AUTOMATED MICROBIAL DETECTION SYSTEM THAT CAN CAPTURE DYNAMIC MICROBIAL ACTIVITY IN VARIOUS FORMS OF WATERS. IN THIS STUDY, FLUORESCENCE SPECTROSCOPY IS USED IN COMBINATION WITH MACHINE LEARNING ALGORITHMS TO DETECT AND QUANTIFY A LARGE RANGE OF CONTAMINANTS IN WATER. THE GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS TO DEMONSTRATE THE MONITORING OF MICROBIOLOGY AGAINST REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS DETERMINING MAINTENANCE SCHEDULING THAT WILL BE DICTATED BY THE TYPES OF WATERS BEING MONITORED. TESTING WILL BE PERFORMED AT RECLAMATION'S WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT CENTER IN YUMA, AZ.

THE NEED EXISTS FOR IMPROVED METHODS OF TREATING HIGH SALINITY BRINES IN A COST-EFFECTIVE MANNER FOR BRACKISH GROUNDWATER DESALINATION, WATER REUSE, AND OTHER APPLICATIONS. THIS PROJECT WILL DEMONSTRATE A PILOT-SCALE MULTIPLE-EFFECT ADSORPTION DISTILLATION SYSTEM WITH A GOAL OF REDUCING THE COST AND ENERGY CONSUMPTION REQUIRED TO TREAT HIGH SALINITY BRINE. THE PROPOSED APPROACH WILL ALSO RECOVER PURE SALTS FOR BENEFICIAL USE. TESTING WILL BE PERFORMED AT A SITE TO BE SELECTED FROM A LIST OF SIX CANDIDATE SITES.

DESALINATION PLANT FEEDWATER CONTAINS MICROORGANISMS WHICH CAN FOUL REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANES AND LEAD TO REDUCED EFFICIENCY AND INCREASING MAINTENANCE COSTS. THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO REDUCE THE COST AND ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT OF DESALINATION BY PREVENTING BIOFOULING ON REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANES AND OTHER KEY COMPONENTS THROUGH INNOVATIVE BIOMATERIALS AND BIOSIGNALS INTELLIGENCE SOLUTIONS. A COATING WILL BE APPLIED TO REVERSE OSMOSIS MEMBRANES AND OTHER COMPONENTS TO PREVENT THE ADHESION OF ORGANISMS. A HARDWARE AND SOFTWARE SYSTEM WILL ALSO BE USED TO MONITOR BIOFILM GROWTH IN REAL-TIME AND IMPROVE MAINTENANCE OPERATIONS. TESTING WILL BE PERFORMED AT RECLAMATION'S WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT CENTER IN YUMA, AZ.

POTABLE REUSE IS INCREASINGLY IMPLEMENTED BY CITIES TO ADDRESS WATER SCARCITY AND BOLSTER SUPPLY. REVERSE OSMOSIS HAS PLAYED AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN THE PRACTICE OF POTABLE REUSE FOR ITS ABILITY TO PRECLUDE HIGH LEVELS OF BOTH DISSOLVED CONSTITUENTS AND PATHOGENS. IN THIS STUDY, A TEST IS PROPOSED OF A NOVEL ONLINE CONTINUOUS MULTI-METALS WATER ANALYZER THAT CAN MEASURE STRONTIUM AND OTHER CONSTITUENTS IN REVERSE OSMOSIS FEEDWATER AND REVERSE OSMOSIS PERMEATE IN REAL OR NEAR REAL-TIME. THE GOAL OF THIS STUDY IS TO DETERMINE THE BENEFITS AND LIMITATIONS OF USING THE NOVEL ONLINE ANALYZER TO ASSESS MEMBRANE INTEGRITY AND MINERAL SCALING POTENTIAL IN REAL OR NEAR REAL-TIME. TESTING WILL BE PERFORMED AT ORANGE COUNTY WATER DISTRICT'S ADVANCED WATER PURIFICATION FACILITY IN FOUNTAIN VALLEY, CALIFORNIA.

AYON TECHNOLOGIES PROPOSES TO PILOT TEST AN INNOVATIVE TECHNOLOGY THAT CONCENTRATES WASTE AND LOWERS DISPOSAL COST. IN THIS PILOT, THEY ARE FOCUSING ON MUNICIPAL UTILITIES SUBJECT TO SPECIFIC TYPES OF CONTAMINANTS (ARSENIC, NITRATE, AND CHROMIUM) DUE TO THE CLEAR USE CASE AND NUMBER OF FACILITIES THAT ARE SUBJECT TO THIS PROBLEM. SPECIFICALLY, AYON SEEKS TO BUILD A PILOT SCALE PROTOTYPE TO CONDUCT FIELD TESTING ON A TECHNOLOGY THAT HAS DEMONSTRATED PROMISING RESULTS AT A BENCH SCALE. MANY MUNICIPAL UTILITIES USE GROUNDWATER SOURCES THAT ARE IMPAIRED WITH TRACE CONTAMINANTS RESULTING IN THE ABANDONMENT OF THEIR LOCAL GROUNDWATER RESOURCES.

WASTE SALT TECHNOLOGIES LLC INTRODUCES A NOVEL APPROACH FOR ELIMINATING THE CONCENTRATE OF THE DESALINATION PROCESSES BY RECOVERING THE WATER CONTENT USING A HEAT-DRIVEN ABSORPTION PROCESS FOLLOWED BY REPURPOSING THE SALT CONTENT OF THE CONCENTRATE AS A MEDIUM FOR LOW-COST THERMAL ENERGY STORAGE. A DETAILED AND EXTENSIVE TECHNO-ECONOMIC ANALYSIS SHOWED THAT USING UNSEPARATED AND MINIMALLY PROCESSED CONCENTRATE SALT REDUCES THE COST OF THERMAL ENERGY STORAGE BELOW THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY'S COST TARGET OF $15 PER KILOWATT-HOUR. WASTE SALT TECHNOLOGIES LLC REPURPOSES THE UNSEPARATED AND MINIMALLY PROCESSED SOLID SALT OF THE DESALINATION PROCESS IN AN INEXPENSIVE, SAFE, MODULAR, AND SCALABLE THERMAL ENERGY STORAGE SYSTEM THAT CAN BE USED TO STORE THERMAL ENERGY FOR A VARIETY OF APPLICATIONS INCLUDING CONCENTRATING SOLAR POWER OR SOLAR DESALINATION.

OCEANSPACE HAS DEVELOPED A SYSTEM FOR ACQUIRING HIGHLY RESOLVED IMAGES OF AQUATIC ORGANISMS RANGING IN SIZE FROM 0.5 MM TO THOSE WITH A MAXIMUM DIAMETER OF 10 MM (THE WIDTH OF THE IMAGING CHAMBER, EQUIVALENT TO AN ORGANISM MAXIMUM SIZE [GENERALLY LENGTH] OF 25 MM OR LARGER). ASSOCIATED DEEP-LEARNING SOFTWARE, COUPLED WITH A LIBRARY OF TAXONOMICALLY CLASSIFIED IMAGES, ALLOWS ASSIGNMENT OF EACH IMAGE TO TAXON. ORGANISM IMAGES ARE SIZED AND ENUMERATED WITHIN TAXON. THE SYSTEM IS CONTINUOUS FLOW-THROUGH, DELIVERS DATA IN NEAR-REAL-TIME, AND IS IDEALLY SUITED FOR INTEGRATION INTO FLOW STREAMS. THEY WILL INSTALL TWO SYSTEMS, ONE ON THE SEAWARD SIDE AND THE OTHER ON THE PLANT SIDE OF A PRESENTLY OPERATING PILOT WEDGEWIRE SCREEN STRUCTURE.

THE PROPOSED CONCERTED REDUCTIVE-OXIDATIVE DEGRADATION OF PFAS AT MICRO/NANOBUBBLE INTERFACE PROJECT (PROJECT) SEEKS TO INCREASE WATER SUPPLIES BY REDUCING THE COST, ENERGY CONSUMPTION, AND/OR ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF TREATING IMPAIRED AND OTHERWISE UNUSABLE WATERS.

THIS PILOT STUDY WILL EVALUATE THE FEASIBILITY OF USING A MINERAL QUENCHING AGENT, IRON (III) OXIDE, WHICH DEMONSTRATED AS GOOD OR BETTER PERFORMANCE COMPARED TO ACTIVATED CARBON IN OUR BENCH-SCALE STUDY. ADVANCED OXIDATION PROCESSES ARE ESSENTIAL IN POTABLE WATER REUSE MULTIBARRIER SYSTEMS, AND SERVE A NUMBER OF PURPOSES IN NON-REUSE DRINKING WATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS, E.G. TASTE AND ODOR IMPROVEMENT OR ALGAL TOXIN DESTRUCTION. THE MOST COMMERCIALLY COMMON ADVANCED OXIDATION PROCESS TYPE IS A COMBINATION OF ULTRAVIOLET LIGHT AND HYDROGEN PEROXIDE. IRON (III) OXIDE MAY OFFER A LESS COSTLY ALTERNATIVE TO ACTIVATED CARBON FOR QUENCHING HYDROGEN PEROXIDE.

THIS PROJECT PROPOSES TO DEVELOP AN INTEGRATIVE APPROACH TO CLIMATE DATA SELECTION THAT TAKES INTO CONSIDERATION CHANGES IN EVENT SEQUENCING AND IDF CURVES, AND TRANSFERRING GUIDANCE, METHODS, AND DATA PRODUCTS BACK TO RECLAMATION. THERE IS AN OPPORTUNITY TO MOVE RECLAMATION TOWARDS A NEW PARADIGM FOR WEST-WIDE FLOOD FREQUENCY ESTIMATES UNDER ANTHROPOGENIC CLIMATE CHANGE. WE PROPOSE AN APPROACH TO DEVELOP ATMOSPHERE AND HYDROLOGY METHODOLOGIES SIMULTANEOUSLY IN YEARS 1 AND 2 AND A DEMONSTRATION SCREENING TOOL TO IDENTIFY CHANGES IN FLOOD FREQUENCY (FF) ESTIMATES IN YEAR 3. WE WILL: 1) PERFORM AN INTEGRATIVE ASSESSMENT OF ESMS FOR THEIR SUITABILITY FOR WEST-WIDE FLOOD PROJECTIONS; 2) ESTIMATE PRECIPITATION EVENT SEQUENCING CHANGES AS WELL AS INITIAL ESTIMATES OF INDIVIDUAL EVENT IDF CURVES USING CMIP5/6 ESMS; 3) USE A RANGE OF DOWNSCALED DATASETS TO EXTRACT HIGH RESOLUTION METEOROLOGICAL INPUTS FOR HYDROLOGIC MODELS; AND 4) PERFORM WEST-WIDE CONTINUOUS AND STOCHASTIC FLOOD SIMULATIONS USING A RECLAMATION-FUNDED INSTANTIATION OF THE SUMMA (STRUCTURE FOR UNIFYING MULTIPLE MODELING ALTERNATIVES; CLARK ET AL., 2015) MODEL.

1. PURPOSE: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE TO DISTRICT PERSONNEL AND PROMOTE THE EFFICIENT DELIVERY OF AGRICULTURAL WATER, ESPECIALLY UNDER PROBLEM SITUATIONS.2. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE PROVIDING DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUAL DISTRICTS FOR WATER EFFICIENCY ISSUES; PROVIDING INDIRECT ASSISTANCE OF RESEARCHING ISSUES THAT SPAN MULTIPLE DISTRICTS; EDUCATING ON WATER MANAGEMENT SUBJECTS; AND COMMUNICATING EXPERTISE THROUGH VARIOUS PROFESSIONAL FORUMS.3. DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND GUIDANCE TO RELIEVE STRAIN ON THE AGRICULTURAL SIDE OF WATER BALANCE AND ENSURE WATER IS MADE AVAILABLE FOR COMPETING USES AMONG THE PUBLIC AND THE ENVIRONMENT. THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR DELIVERY SYSTEM MODERNIZATION AND WATER MANAGER AND CONSERVATION, AS WELL AS CLASSROOM AND HANDS-ON TRAINING FOR EFFICIENT DELIVERY SYSTEM DESIGN, MANAGEMENT, OPERATIONAL PRACTICES, AND FLOW MEASUREMENT AND MANAGEMENT.4. INTENDED BENEFICIARY(IES): THE PUBLIC AND THE ENVIRONMENT

UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, THE RECIPIENT SHALL COLLECT AND ANALYZE SEDIMENT AND WATER SAMPLES FROM THE WILLOW CREEK DRAINAGE AND RESERVOIR AND SUPPORT EVALUATION OF THE FATE AND TRANSPORT OF PHOSPHOROUS AFTER WILDFIRE DRAINAGE AREA TO THE STUDY AREA, A RECLAMATION FACILITY.

WITH THE INCREASINGLY URGENT NEED FOR ADDITIONAL WATER SUPPLIES MANY AMERICAN COMMUNITIES ARE FACING DUE TO POPULATION GROWTH, DROUGHT,CLIMATE CHANGE, AND DWINDLING GROUNDWATER SUPPLIES, POTABLE REUSE IS ALREADY OR SOON TO BE A REALITY FOR MANY. THE PROPOSED PROJECT ADDRESSES CRITICAL RESEARCH NEEDS TO FIND WAYS TO SAFELY AND COST EFFECTIVELY IMPLEMENT POTABLE REUSE SYSTEMS TO MAKE THIS UNCONVENTIONAL WATER SUPPLY MORE VIABLE AS A MUCH-NEEDED AUGMENTATION TO EXISTING WATER SUPPLIES. THIS RESEARCH WILL BENEFIT ANY COMMUNITY OF ANY SIZE, CONSIDERING POTABLE REUSE. WHILE THE DATA GENERATED IN THIS STUDY WILL BE SPECIFIC TO THE WASTEWATER EFFLUENT USED IN EXPERIMENTS, THE FINDINGS WILL BE BROADLY APPLICABLE TO POTABLE REUSE PROJECTS ACROSS THE NATION IN TERMS OF COMPARATIVE PERFORMANCE OF FERRATE TREATMENT TO MORE TYPICAL TREATMENT OPTIONS. THESE RESULTS COULD BE PARTICULARLY VALUABLE TO SMALLER MUNICIPALITIES, FOR WHICH THE COMPLEXITY AND EXPENSE OF EXISTING POTABLE REUSE SYSTEMS CAN BE COST PROHIBITIVE. BY ADVANCING THIS MULTI-BENEFIT TREATMENT PROCESS FOR POTABLE REUSE,THEREBY FACILITATING POTABLE REUSE ADOPTION, LESS STRESS WILL BE PLACED ON RECLAMATION'S WATER SUPPLIES. THIS WILL HELP RECLAMATION MEET ITS MISSION OF DELIVERING WATER TO STAKEHOLDERS AND MANAGING WATER IN THE WEST.

DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED GROUNDWATER AND SURFACE WATER COMPUTER MODEL AND TO EXPAND AND REFINE MWA'S EXISTING GROUNDWATER MODEL BY INCLUDING CRITICAL REGIONAL SURFACE WATER FEATURES.  THE MODEL WILL ENHANCE THE AGENCY'S ABILITY TO CONJUNCTIVELY MANAGE ITS WATER RESOURCES, AS WELL AS IMPROVE THE INTEGRATION OF OPERATION OF THE MOJAVE RIVER DAM FOR FLOOD CONTROL WITH POTENTIAL WATER BANKING AND PUMPED STORAGE INITIATIVES.

THIS PROJECT WILL HELP PROVIDE TIMELY INFORMATION FOR SCHEDULING RESERVOIR RELEASES TO OPTIMIZE STORAGE, WHILE PROVIDING CAPACITY TO ACCEPT STORM RUNOFF, AND WILL ALSO ENABLE BETTER COORDINATION OF RELEASES FROM MULTIPLE RESERVOIRS IN AREA.

WILL DEMONSTRATE OVER A PERIOD OF 18 MONTHS THE EFFICACY OF THE FR-RO DESALINATION TECHNOLOGY FOR A MUNICIPAL REUSE APPLICATION AND DETERMINE THE CAPITAL AND OPERATIONAL COSTS FOR 1 MGD AND 5 MGD FULL-SCALE INLAND REUSE DESALINATION FACILITIES.

THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO ADDRESS IF THIS REGION CAN SUSTAIN GROUNDWATER WITHDRAWALS ON THE ORDER OF UP TO 100,000 ACRE-FEET/YEAR.  TO ADDRESS THIS OBJECTIVE, THIS STUDY WILL EVALUATE THE OVERALL WATER RESOURCE AVAILABILITY AND WATER QUALITY, PARTICULARLY THE GROUNDWATER RESOURCES, IN THE SALT BASIN REGION OF SOUTHERN NEW MEXICO AND SOUTHWESTERN TEXAS.
